statements.name: PROC GCHART
statements.description: Identifies the data set containing the chart variables. Can specify annotation and an output catalog.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data set that contains the variable or variables to chart. If not specified, an input data set must have been created before issuing the PROC GCHART statement.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate all graphs that are produced by the GCHART procedure.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS catalog in which to save the graphics output that is produced by the GCHART procedure. If you omit the libref, SAS/GRAPH looks for the catalog in the temporary library called WORK and creates the catalog if it does not exist.

arguments.name: IMAGEMAP=
arguments.description: creates a temporary SAS data set that is used to generate an image map.

statements.name: BLOCK
statements.description: Creates block charts in which the height of the blocks represents the value of the chart statistic for each category of data.

arguments.name: chart-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables that define the categories of data to chart. Each chart variable draws a separate chart. All variables must be in the input data set. Separate multiple chart variables with blanks. The values of a chart variable used with the BLOCK statement have a maximum length of 13.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate all graphs that are produced by the GCHART procedure.

arguments.name: BLOCKMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the chart statistic value of the tallest block on the chart.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the midpoint grid.

arguments.name: COUTLINE=
arguments.description: outlines all blocks or all block segments and legend values in the subgroup legend (if it appears) using the specified color.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies a color for all text on the grid and legend.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: treats a numeric chart variable as a discrete variable rather than as a continuous variable.

arguments.name: FREQ=
arguments.description: specifies a variable whose values weight the contribution of each observation in the computation of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: G100
arguments.description: calculates the percentage and cumulative percentage statistics separately for each group.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: organizes the data according to the values of group-variable.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: HTML_LEGEND=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: assigns the specified global LEGEND definition to the legend generated by the SUBGROUP= option.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of midpoints to be graphed for the chart variable.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: specifies the midpoint values for the blocks.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: generates default midpoints using the Nelder algorithm (Applied Statistics 25:94â€“7, 1976).

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid midpoint for the chart variable.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NOHEADING
arguments.description: suppresses the heading describing the type of statistic.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: suppresses the legend automatically generated by the SUBGROUP= option.

arguments.name: PATTERNID=
arguments.description: specifies how fill patterns are assigned.

arguments.name: BY
arguments.description: changes patterns each time the value of the BY variable changes. All blocks use the same pattern if the GCHART procedure does not include a BY statement.

arguments.name: GROUP
arguments.description: changes patterns every time the value of the group variable changes. All blocks in each group (row) use the same pattern, but a different pattern is used for each group.

arguments.name: MIDPOINT
arguments.description: changes patterns every time the midpoint value changes. If you use the GROUP= option, the respective midpoint patterns are repeated for each group.

arguments.name: SUBGROUP
arguments.description: changes patterns every time the value of the subgroup variable changes. The blocks must be subdivided by the SUBGROUP= option for the SUBGROUP value to have an effect. Without the SUBGROUP= option, all block faces have the same pattern.

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: overrides the GCHART default format of the displayed statistical value.

arguments.name: SUBGROUP=
arguments.description: divides the blocks into segments according to the values of subgroup-variable.

arguments.name: SUMVAR=
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable for sum or mean calculations.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the chart statistic.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: WOUTLINE=
arguments.description: specifies the width of the block outline in pixels.

statements.name: HBAR
statements.description: Create horizontal bar charts in which the length or height of the bars represents the value of the chart statistic for each category of data.

arguments.name: chart-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables that define the categories of data to chart. Each chart variable draws a separate chart. All variables must be in the input data set. Multiple chart variables must be separated with blanks.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate all graphs that are produced by the GCHART procedure.

arguments.name: ASCENDING
arguments.description: arranges the bars in ascending order of the value of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: AUTOREF
arguments.description: draws a reference line at each major tick mark on the response axis.

arguments.name: AXIS=
arguments.description: specifies values for the major tick marks or assigns specified global AXIS statement definitions to the axis.

arguments.name: CAUTOREF=
arguments.description: specifies the color of reference lines drawn at major tick marks, as determined by the AUTOREF option.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies a color for the response and midpoint axis lines and for the default axis area frame.

arguments.name: CERROR=
arguments.description: specifies the color of error bars in bar charts.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: specifies the color with which to fill the axis area in two-dimensional bar charts or the floor, back wall, and side wall of three-dimensional bar charts.

arguments.name: CFREQ
arguments.description: displays the cumulative frequency statistic in the table of statistics and above vertical bars.

arguments.name: CFREQLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies the text of the column label for the CFREQ statistic in the table of statistics.

arguments.name: CGROUPREF
arguments.description: specifies the color of the reference line dividing each group of bars produced with the HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: CLIPREF
arguments.description: clips the reference lines at the bars.

arguments.name: CLM=
arguments.description: specifies the confidence intervals to use when drawing error bars.

arguments.name: CMIDPOINTREF
arguments.description: specifies the color of the midpoint reference lines between bars produced with the HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: COUTLINE=
arguments.description: outlines all bars or bar segments and legend values in the subgroup legend (if it appears) using the specified color.

arguments.name: CPERCENT
arguments.description: displays the cumulative percentage statistic in the table of statistics and above vertical bars.

arguments.name: CPERCENTLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies the text of the column label for the CPERCENT statistic in the table of statistics.

arguments.name: CREF=
arguments.description: specifies colors for reference lines.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies a color for all text on the axes and legend, including axis labels, tick mark values, legend labels, and legend value descriptions.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: arranges the bars in descending order of the value of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: treats a numeric chart variable as a discrete variable rather than as a continuous variable.

arguments.name: ERRORBAR=
arguments.description: draws confidence levels.

arguments.name: BARS
arguments.description: draws error bars as bars half the width of the main bars.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: draws error bars as two ticks joined by a line (default).

arguments.name: TOP
arguments.description: draws the error bar as a tick for the upper confidence limit that is joined to the top of the bar by a line.

arguments.name: FRAME
arguments.description: specifies that a line is drawn around the axis area of a two-dimensional bar chart.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: displays the frequency statistic in the table of statistics and above vertical bars.

arguments.name: FREQLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies the text of the column label for the FREQ statistic in the table of statistics.

arguments.name: FREQ=
arguments.description: specifies a variable whose values weight the contribution of each observation in the computation of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: FRONTREF
arguments.description: specifies that reference lines drawn by the AUTOREF or REF= options should be drawn in front of the bars.

arguments.name: G100
arguments.description: calculates the percentage and cumulative percentage statistics separately for each group.

arguments.name: GAXIS=
arguments.description: assigns the specified global AXIS definition to the group axis.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: organizes the data according to values of group-variable.

arguments.name: GROUPREF
arguments.description: draws a reference line dividing each group of bars produced by the HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: GSPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space between groups of bars.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: HTML_LEGEND=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: IFRAME=
arguments.description: identifies the image file that you want to apply to a two-dimensional chart's axis area or a three-dimensional chart's back wall.

arguments.name: IMAGESTYLE=
arguments.description: specifies whether to use multiple instances of an image, or stretch a single image.

arguments.name: INSIDE=
arguments.description: displays the values of the specified statistic inside the bars.

arguments.name: LAUTOREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line type for reference lines at major tick marks, as determined by the AUTOREF option.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: assigns the specified global LEGEND definition to the legend generated by the SUBGROUP= option.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of midpoints to be graphed for a chart variable.

arguments.name: LGROUPREF=
arguments.description: specifies line types for reference lines dividing each group of bars produced by the HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: LMIDPOINTREF=
arguments.description: specifies line types for midpoint reference lines between bars produced by HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: LREF=
arguments.description: specifies line types for reference lines.

arguments.name: MAXIS=
arguments.description: assigns the specified global AXIS definition to the midpoint axis.

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: displays the mean statistic in the table of statistics and above vertical bars.

arguments.name: MEANLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies the text of the column label for the MEAN statistic in the table of statistics.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTREF
arguments.description: draws a reference line at the midpoint between each bar produced by the HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: specifies the midpoint values for the bars.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: generates default midpoints using the Nelder algorithm (Applied Statistics 25:94â€“7, 1976).

arguments.name: MINOR=
arguments.description: specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the response axis.

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid midpoint for the chart variable.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NOAXIS
arguments.description: suppresses all axes, including axis lines, axis labels, axis values, and all major and minor tick marks.

arguments.name: NOBASEREF
arguments.description: suppresses the zero reference line when the SUM or MEAN chart statistic has negative values.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: specifies that no line is drawn around the axis area of a two-dimensional bar chart.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: suppresses the legend that is automatically generated by the SUBGROUP= option.

arguments.name: NOSTATS
arguments.description: suppresses the table of statistics.

arguments.name: NOSYMBOL
arguments.description: suppresses the legend that is automatically generated by the SUBGROUP= option.

arguments.name: NOZERO
arguments.description: suppresses any midpoints for which there are no corresponding values of the chart variable and, hence, no bar.

arguments.name: OUTSIDE=
arguments.description: displays the values of the specified statistic above the bars.

arguments.name: PATTERNID=
arguments.description: specifies how fill patterns are assigned.

arguments.name: BY
arguments.description: changes patterns each time the value of the BY variable changes. All bars use the same pattern if the GCHART procedure does not include a BY statement.

arguments.name: GROUP
arguments.description: changes patterns every time the value of the group variable changes. All bars in each group use the same pattern, but a different pattern is used for each group.

arguments.name: MIDPOINT
arguments.description: changes patterns every time the midpoint value changes. If you use the GROUP= option, the respective midpoint patterns are repeated for each group.

arguments.name: SUBGROUP
arguments.description: changes patterns every time the value of the subgroup variable changes. The bars must be subdivided by the SUBGROUP= option for the SUBGROUP value to have an effect. Without the SUBGROUP= option, all bars have the same pattern.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: prints the percentages of observations having a given value for the chart variable in the table of statistics and above vertical bars.

arguments.name: PERCENTLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies the text of the column label for the PERCENT statistic in the table of statistics.

arguments.name: PERCENTSUM
arguments.description: calculates a percent of the sum variable for horizontal or vertical bar charts.

arguments.name: RANGE
arguments.description: displays on the axis of the chart the range of numeric values represented by each bar.

arguments.name: RAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies values for the major tick mark divisions on the response axis or assigns specified global AXIS statement definitions to the axis.

arguments.name: REF=
arguments.description: draws reference lines at the specified points on the response axis.

arguments.name: SPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of space between individual bars or between the bars within each group if you also use the GROUP= option.

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: overrides the GCHART default format of the displayed statistical value.

arguments.name: SUBGROUP=
arguments.description: divides the bars into segments according to the values of subgroup-variable.

arguments.name: SUMLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies the text of the column label for the SUM statistic in the table of statistics.

arguments.name: SUMVAR=
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable for sum or mean calculations.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the chart statistic.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: WAUTOREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line width for reference lines at major tick marks, as determined by the AUTOREF option.

arguments.name: WGROUPREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line width for reference lines between groups of bars produced by the HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: WMIDPOINTREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line width for midpoint reference lines between bars produced by the HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: WIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies the width of the bars.

arguments.name: WOUTLINE=
arguments.description: specifies the width of the outline in pixels.

arguments.name: WREF=
arguments.description: specifies line widths for reference lines.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: organizes the data according to values of group-variable.

arguments.name: GROUPREF
arguments.description: draws a reference line dividing each group of bars produced by the HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: GSPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space between groups of bars.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: HTML_LEGEND=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: IFRAME=
arguments.description: identifies the image file that you want to apply to a two-dimensional chart's axis area or a three-dimensional chart's back wall.

arguments.name: IMAGESTYLE=
arguments.description: specifies whether to use multiple instances of an image, or stretch a single image.

arguments.name: INSIDE=
arguments.description: displays the values of the specified statistic inside the bars.

arguments.name: LAUTOREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line type for reference lines at major tick marks, as determined by the AUTOREF option.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: assigns the specified global LEGEND definition to the legend generated by the SUBGROUP= option.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of midpoints to be graphed for a chart variable.

arguments.name: LGROUPREF=
arguments.description: specifies line types for reference lines dividing each group of bars produced by the HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: LMIDPOINTREF=
arguments.description: specifies line types for midpoint reference lines between bars produced by HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: LREF=
arguments.description: specifies line types for reference lines.

arguments.name: MAXIS=
arguments.description: assigns the specified global AXIS definition to the midpoint axis.

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: displays the mean statistic in the table of statistics and above vertical bars.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTREF
arguments.description: draws a reference line at the midpoint between each bar produced by the HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: specifies the midpoint values for the bars.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: generates default midpoints using the Nelder algorithm (Applied Statistics 25:94â€“7, 1976).

arguments.name: MINOR=
arguments.description: specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the response axis.

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid midpoint for the chart variable.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NOAXIS
arguments.description: suppresses all axes, including axis lines, axis labels, axis values, and all major and minor tick marks.

arguments.name: NOBASEREF
arguments.description: suppresses the zero reference line when the SUM or MEAN chart statistic has negative values.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: specifies that no line is drawn around the axis area of a two-dimensional bar chart.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: suppresses the legend that is automatically generated by the SUBGROUP= option.

arguments.name: NOSYMBOL
arguments.description: suppresses the legend that is automatically generated by the SUBGROUP= option.

arguments.name: NOZERO
arguments.description: suppresses any midpoints for which there are no corresponding values of the chart variable and, hence, no bar.

arguments.name: OUTSIDE=
arguments.description: displays the values of the specified statistic above the bars.

arguments.name: PATTERNID=
arguments.description: specifies how fill patterns are assigned.

arguments.name: BY
arguments.description: changes patterns each time the value of the BY variable changes. All bars use the same pattern if the GCHART procedure does not include a BY statement.

arguments.name: GROUP
arguments.description: changes patterns every time the value of the group variable changes. All bars in each group use the same pattern, but a different pattern is used for each group.

arguments.name: MIDPOINT
arguments.description: changes patterns every time the midpoint value changes. If you use the GROUP= option, the respective midpoint patterns are repeated for each group.

arguments.name: SUBGROUP
arguments.description: changes patterns every time the value of the subgroup variable changes. The bars must be subdivided by the SUBGROUP= option for the SUBGROUP value to have an effect. Without the SUBGROUP= option, all bars have the same pattern.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: prints the percentages of observations having a given value for the chart variable in the table of statistics and above vertical bars.

arguments.name: PERCENTSUM
arguments.description: calculates a percent of the sum variable for horizontal or vertical bar charts.

arguments.name: RANGE
arguments.description: displays on the axis of the chart the range of numeric values represented by each bar.

arguments.name: RAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies values for the major tick mark divisions on the response axis or assigns specified global AXIS statement definitions to the axis.

arguments.name: REF=
arguments.description: draws reference lines at the specified points on the response axis.

arguments.name: SHAPE=
arguments.description: specifies the shape of the bars in charts that are produced with the HBAR3D and VBAR3D statements.

arguments.name: SPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of space between individual bars or between the bars within each group if you also use the GROUP= option.

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: overrides the GCHART default format of the displayed statistical value.

arguments.name: SUBGROUP=
arguments.description: divides the bars into segments according to the values of subgroup-variable.

arguments.name: SUBOUTSIDE=
arguments.description: displays a list of the subgroup values of the specified statistic above the bars.

arguments.name: SUM
arguments.description: displays the sum statistic in the table of statistics and above vertical bars.

arguments.name: SUMVAR=
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable for sum or mean calculations.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the chart statistic.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: WAUTOREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line width for reference lines at major tick marks, as determined by the AUTOREF option.

arguments.name: WGROUPREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line width for reference lines between groups of bars produced by the HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: WMIDPOINTREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line width for midpoint reference lines between bars produced by the HBAR and VBAR statements.

arguments.name: WIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies the width of the bars.

arguments.name: WOUTLINE=
arguments.description: specifies the width of the outline in pixels.

arguments.name: WREF=
arguments.description: specifies line widths for reference lines.

statements.name: VBAR3D
statements.description: Create vertical charts in which the length of the bars represents the value of the chart statistic for each category of data.

arguments.name: chart-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables that define the categories of data to chart. Each chart variable draws a separate chart. All variables must be in the input data set. Multiple chart variables must be separated with blanks.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate all graphs that are produced by the GCHART procedure.

arguments.name: ASCENDING
arguments.description: arranges the bars in ascending order of the value of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: AUTOREF
arguments.description: draws a reference line at each major tick mark on the response axis.

arguments.name: AXIS=
arguments.description: specifies values for the major tick marks or assigns specified global AXIS statement definitions to the axis.

arguments.name: CAUTOREF=
arguments.description: specifies the color of reference lines drawn at major tick marks, as determined by the AUTOREF option.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies a color for the response and midpoint axis lines and for the default axis area frame.

arguments.name: CERROR=
arguments.description: specifies the color of error bars in bar charts.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: specifies the color with which to fill the axis area in two-dimensional bar charts or the floor, back wall, and side wall of three-dimensional bar charts.

arguments.name: CFREQ
arguments.description: displays the cumulative frequency statistic in the table of statistics and above vertical bars.

arguments.name: CLIPREF
arguments.description: clips the reference lines at the bars.

arguments.name: CLM=
arguments.description: specifies the confidence intervals to use when drawing error bars.

arguments.name: COUTLINE=
arguments.description: outlines all bars or bar segments and legend values in the subgroup legend (if it appears) using the specified color.

arguments.name: CPERCENT
arguments.description: displays the cumulative percentage statistic in the table of statistics and above vertical bars.

arguments.name: CREF=
arguments.description: specifies colors for reference lines.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies a color for all text on the axes and legend, including axis labels, tick mark values, legend labels, and legend value descriptions.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: arranges the bars in descending order of the value of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: treats a numeric chart variable as a discrete variable rather than as a continuous variable.

arguments.name: ERRORBAR=
arguments.description: draws confidence levels.

arguments.name: BARS
arguments.description: draws error bars as bars half the width of the main bars.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: draws error bars as two ticks joined by a line (default).

arguments.name: TOP
arguments.description: draws the error bar as a tick for the upper confidence limit that is joined to the top of the bar by a line.

arguments.name: FRAME
arguments.description: specifies that a back wall is drawn in a three-dimensional bar chart.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: displays the frequency statistic in the table of statistics and above vertical bars.

arguments.name: FREQ=
arguments.description: specifies a variable whose values weight the contribution of each observation in the computation of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: FRONTREF
arguments.description: specifies that reference lines drawn by the AUTOREF or REF= options should be drawn in front of the bars.

arguments.name: G100
arguments.description: calculates the percentage and cumulative percentage statistics separately for each group.

statements.name: PIE
statements.description: create pie charts. The size of a pie slice represents the value of the chart statistic for that category of data in relation to the total chart statistic for all categories.

arguments.name: chart-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables that define the categories of data to chart. Each chart variable draws a separate chart. All variables must be in the input data set. Separate multiple chart variables with blanks.

arguments.name: ACROSS=
arguments.description: draws number-of-columns pies across the procedure output area.

arguments.name: ANGLE=
arguments.description: starts the first slice at the specified angle.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate all graphs that are produced by the GCHART procedure.

arguments.name: ASCENDING
arguments.description: arranges the slices in ascending order of the value of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: CFILL=
arguments.description: specifies one color for all patterns in the chart, regardless of whether the fill is solid or hatch.

arguments.name: CLOCKWISE
arguments.description: draws the slices clockwise starting at the twelve o'clock position.

arguments.name: COUTLINE=
arguments.description: outlines all slices, rings (subgroups), and legend values (if a legend appears) in the specified color.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies a color for all text on the axes and legend.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: arranges the slices in descending order of the value of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: DETAIL=
arguments.description: produces an inner pie overlay whose slices show the major components that comprise the outer pie's slice.

arguments.name: DETAIL_PERCENT=
arguments.description: specifies the algorithm to use for displaying the percentage values for the detail pie slices.

arguments.name: DETAIL_RADIUS=
arguments.description: determines the size of the detail pie.

arguments.name: DETAIL_SLICE=
arguments.description: specifies the algorithm to use for displaying the detail variable labels for the inner pie slices.

arguments.name: DETAIL_THRESHOLD=
arguments.description: determines whether a detail slice is included in the inner pie.

arguments.name: DETAIL_VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the algorithm to use for displaying the data values for the detail pie slices.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: treats a numeric chart variable as a discrete variable rather than as a continuous variable.

arguments.name: DOWN=
arguments.description: draws number-of-rows pies vertically in the procedure output area.

arguments.name: EXPLODE=
arguments.description: pulls the specified slices slightly out from the rest of the pie for added emphasis.

arguments.name: FILL=
arguments.description: specifies the fill pattern for all slices in the chart.

arguments.name: FREQ=
arguments.description: specifies a variable whose values weight the contribution of each observation in the computation of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: organizes the data according to values of group-variable and produces a separate pie (or donut) chart for each unique value of group-variable.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: HTML_LEGEND=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: INVISIBLE=
arguments.description: makes the specified slices invisible, as if they had been removed from the pie.

arguments.name: JSTYLE
arguments.description: arranges the midpoints in descending order of the statistic value and draws the slices clockwise starting at the twelve o'clock position.

arguments.name: LEGEND
arguments.description: generates a legend for the slice names (midpoint values) instead of printing them beside the slices.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of midpoints to be graphed for a chart variable.

arguments.name: MATCHCOLOR
arguments.description: uses the slice pattern color for all slice labels.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: specifies the midpoint values for the slices.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: generates default midpoints using the Nelder algorithm (Applied Statistics 25:94â€“7, 1976).

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid midpoint for the chart variable.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NOGROUPHEADING
arguments.description: suppresses the headings that are normally printed above each pie when you use the GROUP= option.

arguments.name: NOHEADING
arguments.description: suppresses the heading that is normally printed at the top of each page or display of output for all devices except JAVAIMG.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: suppresses the legend that is automatically generated by the SUBGROUP= option.

arguments.name: OTHER=
arguments.description: collects all midpoints with chart statistic values less than or equal to percent-of-total into a generic midpoint named OTHER.

arguments.name: OTHERCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color to use for the OTHER slice.

arguments.name: OTHERLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a text string up to 16 characters for the label for the OTHER slice.

arguments.name: PERCENT=
arguments.description: prints the percentage represented by each slice using the specified labeling method.

arguments.name: PLABEL=
arguments.description: modifies the font, height, and color of the pie slice labels.

arguments.name: PPERCENT=
arguments.description: modifies the font, height, and color of the displayed percentages associated with the pie slice labels.

arguments.name: RADIUS=
arguments.description: specifies the radius of the pie and donut in their respective charts.

arguments.name: SLICE=
arguments.description: controls the position and style of the slice name (midpoint value) for each slice.

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: overrides the GCHART default format of the displayed statistical value.

arguments.name: SUBGROUP=
arguments.description: divides the chart into concentric rings according to the values of subgroup-variable.

arguments.name: SUMVAR=
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable for sum or mean calculations.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the chart statistic.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: controls the position and style of the slice value (chart statistic) for each slice.

arguments.name: WOUTLINE=
arguments.description: specifies the width of the outline in pixels.

arguments.name: DETAIL_RADIUS=
arguments.description: determines the size of the detail pie.

arguments.name: DETAIL_SLICE=
arguments.description: specifies the algorithm to use for displaying the detail variable labels for the inner pie slices.

arguments.name: DETAIL_THRESHOLD=
arguments.description: determines whether a detail slice is included in the inner pie.

arguments.name: DETAIL_VALUE=
arguments.description: specifies the algorithm to use for displaying the data values for the detail pie slices.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: treats a numeric chart variable as a discrete variable rather than as a continuous variable.

arguments.name: DONUTPCT=
arguments.description: specifies the size of the donut hole in percent of the radius of the whole chart.

arguments.name: DOWN=
arguments.description: draws number-of-rows pies vertically in the procedure output area.

arguments.name: EXPLODE=
arguments.description: pulls the specified slices slightly out from the rest of the pie for added emphasis.

arguments.name: FILL=
arguments.description: specifies the fill pattern for all slices in the chart.

arguments.name: FREQ=
arguments.description: specifies a variable whose values weight the contribution of each observation in the computation of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: organizes the data according to values of group-variable and produces a separate pie (or donut) chart for each unique value of group-variable.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: HTML_LEGEND=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: INVISIBLE=
arguments.description: makes the specified slices invisible, as if they had been removed from the pie.

arguments.name: JSTYLE
arguments.description: arranges the midpoints in descending order of the statistic value and draws the slices clockwise starting at the twelve o'clock position.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: defines the text that is displayed in the donut hole.

arguments.name: #BYVAL
arguments.description: substitutes the current value of the specified BY variable for #BYVAL in the text string and displays the value produced by the statement. Specify the variable with one of these values:

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies which variable in the BY statement #BYVAL should use. The value of n indicates the position of the variable in the BY statement.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: names the BY variable.

arguments.name: #BYVAR
arguments.description: substitutes the name of the BY variable or label associated with the variable (whatever the BY line would normally display) for #BYVAR in the text string and displays the name or label produced by the statement. Specify the variable with one of these:

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies which variable in the BY statement #BYVAR should use. The value of n indicates the position of the variable in the BY statement. For example, #BYVAR2 specifies the second variable in the BY statement.

arguments.name: BY-variable-name
arguments.description: names the BY variable. For example, #BYVAR(SITES) specifies the BY variable, SITES. Variable-name is not case sensitive.

arguments.name: text-description-suboption
arguments.description: modifies a characteristic such as the font, color, or size of the text string(s) that follows it. Text-description-suboption can be â€¢ ANGLE=degrees â€¢ COLOR=color â€¢ FONT=font â€¢ HEIGHT=text-height <units> â€¢ JUSTIFY=LEFT | CENTER | RIGHT â€¢ ROTATE=degrees

arguments.name: LEGEND
arguments.description: generates a legend for the slice names (midpoint values) instead of printing them beside the slices.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of midpoints to be graphed for a chart variable.

arguments.name: MATCHCOLOR
arguments.description: uses the slice pattern color for all slice labels.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: specifies the midpoint values for the slices.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: generates default midpoints using the Nelder algorithm (Applied Statistics 25:94â€“7, 1976).

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid midpoint for the chart variable.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NOGROUPHEADING
arguments.description: suppresses the headings that are normally printed above each pie when you use the GROUP= option.

arguments.name: NOHEADING
arguments.description: suppresses the heading that is normally printed at the top of each page or display of output for all devices except JAVAIMG.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: suppresses the legend that is automatically generated by the SUBGROUP= option.

arguments.name: OTHER=
arguments.description: collects all midpoints with chart statistic values less than or equal to percent-of-total into a generic midpoint named OTHER.

arguments.name: OTHERCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color to use for the OTHER slice.

arguments.name: OTHERLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a text string up to 16 characters for the label for the OTHER slice.

arguments.name: PERCENT=
arguments.description: prints the percentage represented by each slice using the specified labeling method.

arguments.name: PLABEL=
arguments.description: modifies the font, height, and color of the pie slice labels.

arguments.name: PPERCENT=
arguments.description: modifies the font, height, and color of the displayed percentages associated with the pie slice labels.

arguments.name: RADIUS=
arguments.description: specifies the radius of the pie and donut in their respective charts.

arguments.name: SLICE=
arguments.description: controls the position and style of the slice name (midpoint value) for each slice.

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: overrides the GCHART default format of the displayed statistical value.

arguments.name: SUBGROUP=
arguments.description: divides the chart into concentric rings according to the values of subgroup-variable.

arguments.name: SUMVAR=
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable for sum or mean calculations.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the chart statistic.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: controls the position and style of the slice value (chart statistic) for each slice.

arguments.name: WOUTLINE=
arguments.description: specifies the width of the outline in pixels.

arguments.name: ANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle at which the baseline of the text string or strings is rotated with respect to the horizontal. A positive value for degrees moves the baseline counterclockwise; a negative value moves it clockwise. By default, ANGLE=0 (horizontal).

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the text string or strings. The COLOR= suboption stays in effect until another COLOR= specification is encountered. If you omit the COLOR= option, the LABEL= option uses the color defined by the current style.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: specifies the font for the text string or strings. If you omit the FONT= option, the LABEL= option uses the font that is specified by the FTEXT= graphics option. If no font is specified, it uses the default hardware font, NONE.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height of the text string or strings. Text-height is the number of units. If you omit the HEIGHT= option, the LABEL= option uses the height that is specified by the HTEXT= graphics option. If no text height is specified and if the default text height is too large for the donut hole, the size of the label is reduced to fit. Units can be CELLS | CM | IN | PCT | PT. If you omit units, then the HEIGHT= option uses the unit that is specified by the GUNIT= graphics option, or the default unit, CELLS.

arguments.name: JUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the alignment of the text string or strings. By default, JUSTIFY=CENTER.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle at which each character is rotated with respect to the baseline of the text string. The angle is measured from the current text baseline angle specified by the ANGLE= suboption. A positive value for degrees rotates the character counterclockwise; a negative value rotates it clockwise. By default, ROTATE=0 (parallel to the baseline).

statements.name: STAR
statements.description: Creates star charts in which the length of the spines represents the value of the chart statistic for each category of data or midpoint.

arguments.name: chart-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables that define the categories of data to chart. Each chart variable draws a separate chart. All variables must be in the input data set. Separate multiple chart variables with blanks.

arguments.name: ACROSS=
arguments.description: draws number-of-columns stars across the procedure output area.

arguments.name: ANGLE=
arguments.description: starts the first slice at the specified angle.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate all graphs that are produced by the GCHART procedure.

arguments.name: ASCENDING
arguments.description: arranges the bars in ascending order of the value of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: CFILL=
arguments.description: specifies one color for all slices in the chart, regardless of whether the fill is solid or hatch.

arguments.name: COUTLINE=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the circle that surrounds the star chart and for the slice outlines or spines.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies a color for all text on the axes and legend.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: arranges the bars in descending order of the value of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: treats a numeric chart variable as a discrete variable rather than as a continuous variable.

arguments.name: DOWN=
arguments.description: draws number-of-rows stars vertically in the procedure output area.

arguments.name: FILL=
arguments.description: specifies the fill pattern for all slices in the star chart.

arguments.name: SOLID
arguments.description: rotates a solid fill through the list of colors available in the default style as many times as necessary. SOLID is the default.

arguments.name: X
arguments.description: rotates a single hatch pattern through the list of colors defined in the current style. If you do not specify the COLORS= option on the GOPTIONS system option, the fill skips the first color in the color list.

arguments.name: FREQ=
arguments.description: specifies a variable whose values weight the contribution of each observation in the computation of the chart statistic.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: organizes the data according to values of group-variable and produces a separate star chart for each unique value of group-variable.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: HTML_LEGEND=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: assigns the specified LEGEND definition to the legend generated by the SUBGROUP= option.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies number of midpoints to be graphed for a chart variable.

arguments.name: MATCHCOLOR
arguments.description: uses the slice pattern color for all slice labels.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: specifies the midpoint values for the slices.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: generates default midpoints using the Nelder algorithm (Applied Statistics 25:94â€“7, 1976).

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid midpoint for the chart variable.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NOCONNECT
arguments.description: draws only star spines without connecting lines.

arguments.name: NOGROUPHEADING
arguments.description: suppresses the headings normally printed above each star when you use the GROUP= option.

arguments.name: NOHEADING
arguments.description: suppresses the heading normally printed at the top of each page or display of star chart output.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: suppresses the legend automatically generated by the SUBGROUP= option.

arguments.name: PERCENT=
arguments.description: prints the percentage represented by each slice using the specified labeling method.

arguments.name: SLICE=
arguments.description: controls the position and style of the slice name (midpoint value) for each slice.

arguments.name: STARMAX=
arguments.description: scales the chart so that the outside (or edge) of the circle represents the value that is specified by max-value.

arguments.name: STARMIN=
arguments.description: scales the chart so that the center of the circle represents the value that is specified by min-value.

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: overrides the GCHART default format of the displayed statistical value.

arguments.name: SUMVAR=
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable for sum or mean calculations.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the chart statistic.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: VALUE=
arguments.description: controls the position and style of the slice value (chart statistic) for each slice.

arguments.name: WOUTLINE=
arguments.description: specifies the width of the outline in pixels.

statements.name: ATTRIB
statements.description: Associates a format, informat, label, and length with one or more variables.

arguments.name: variable-list
arguments.description: names the variables that you want to associate with the attributes.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: associates a format with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: INFORMAT=
arguments.description: associates an informat with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: associates a label with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LENGTH=
arguments.description: specifies the length of variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: TRANSCODE=
arguments.description: specifies whether character variables can be transcoded. Use TRANSCODE=NO to suppress transcoding. Variables with TRANSCODE=NO are not returned.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Orders the output according to the BY groups.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable that the procedure uses to form BY groups. You can specify more than one variable. If you do not use the NOTSORTED option in the BY statement, then either the observations in the data set must be sorted by all the variables that you specify, or they must be indexed appropriately. Variables in a BY statement are called BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order. The observations are grouped in another way (for example, chronological order).

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: names one or more variables for SAS to associate with a format. You must specify at least one variable.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: specifies the format that is listed for writing the values of the variables.

arguments.name: DEFAULT=
arguments.description: specifies a temporary default format for displaying the values of variables that are not listed in the FORMAT statement. These default formats apply only to the current DATA step; they are not permanently associated with variables in the output data set.

statements.name: LABEL
statements.help:
Form 1: Creates a descriptive label for one or more variables.
LABEL  variable-1=â€™text-stringâ€™ < ...variable-n=â€™text-string>; 
Form 2: Removes the label from one or more variables.
LABEL  variable-1 = ' ' < ...variable-n=â€™ â€˜>; | variable-1 = < ...variable-n= >

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: specifies a label of up to 256 bytes.
removes a label from a variable. Enclose a single blank space in quotation marks to remove an existing label. You can remove labels from multiple variables in a single LABEL statement:

statements.name: NOTE
statements.description: Control the content, appearance, and placement of text.

arguments.name: ALT=
arguments.description: specifies descriptive text for a URL to which a note links, or the note itself.

arguments.name: ANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of the baseline of the entire text string with respect to the horizontal.

arguments.name: BCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the background color of a box produced by the BOX= option.

arguments.name: BLANK=
arguments.description: protects the box and its contents from being overwritten by any subsequent graphics elements.

arguments.name: BOX=
arguments.description: draws a box around one line of text.

arguments.name: BSPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of space between the boxed text and the box.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the following text, box, or line.

arguments.name: DRAW=
arguments.description: draws lines anywhere on the graphics output area.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: specifies the font for the subsequent text.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height of text characters in number of units.

arguments.name: JUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the alignment of the text string.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: aligns the text to the left.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: aligns the text in the center.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: aligns the text to the right.

arguments.name: LANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of the entire text-string(s).

arguments.name: LINK=
arguments.description: specifies a uniform resource locator (URL) to which a note links.

arguments.name: LSPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of spacing above and below lines of text.

arguments.name: MOVE=
arguments.description: positions a text string.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle at which each character of text is rotated.

arguments.name: UNDERLIN=
arguments.description: underlines subsequent text.

arguments.name: WRAP
arguments.description: wraps the text to a second line if the text does not fit on one line.

arguments.name: #BYLINE
arguments.description: substitutes the entire BY line without leading or trailing blanks for #BYLINE in the text string. It also displays the BY line in the note produced by the statement.

arguments.name: #BYVAL
arguments.description: substitutes the current value of the specified BY variable for #BYVAL in the text string and displays the value produced by the statement. Specify the variable with one of these values:

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies which variable in the BY statement #BYVAL should use. The value of n indicates the position of the variable in the BY statement.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: names the BY variable.

arguments.name: #BYVAR
arguments.description: substitutes the name of the BY variable or label associated with the variable (whatever the BY line would normally display) for #BYVAR in the text string and displays the name or label produced by the statement. Specify the variable with one of these:

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies which variable in the BY statement #BYVAR should use. The value of n indicates the position of the variable in the BY statement. For example, #BYVAR2 specifies the second variable in the BY statement.

arguments.name: BY-variable-name
arguments.description: names the BY variable. For example, #BYVAR(SITES) specifies the BY variable, SITES. Variable-name is not case sensitive.

statements.name: QUIT
statements.description: Executes any statements that have not executed and ends the procedure step.

statements.name: WHERE
statements.description: Subsets the input data set by specifying certain conditions that each observation must meet before it is available for processing.

arguments.name: where-expression
arguments.description: is an arithmetic or logical expression that generally consists of a sequence of operands and operators. For more information about where processing, see .
